intro: Calandrinia oppositifolia, commonly known as the oppositeleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and produces small, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Calandrinia oppositifolia is drought-tolerant and has a compact growth habit, making it suitable for xeriscaping.
